history.content: Even if your CS major application is processed, it won't be until next Fall that you would be given CS major status for enrollment. So no, no retroactive elevation.

Hello,

I am currently planning for the Spring 2019 semester and I am on the waitlist for three classes, CS170, CS186, and CS161. In each class there are seats reserved for declared CS majors. As far as I am aware, the adjustment period starting on Jan.7 allows everyone to enroll in these classes, ignoring the reserved seating and allowing the waitlist to 'funnel' in. In this case, I would not be able to enroll in each class because I am in the back of the waitlists. However, if my CS major application is processed before then, and I am accepted I should be able to get into each class. Am I interpreting this correctly? I just want to make sure I meet the minimum unit requirement and can take classes I need. Any help would be greatly appreciated, thank you!
history.subject: Reserved Seating vs. Adjustment Period
